attachments.title: David Sedaris: Living the Fitbit Life
attachments.text: I look back on the days I averaged only thirty thousand steps, and think, Honestly, how lazy can you get?
attachments.fallback: The New Yorker: David Sedaris: Living the Fitbit Life

text: saw this yesterday, and although i'm the first to make fun of the misfit shine jewelry play, this actually got me interested. not sure what that says about this or me yet. <http://mashable.com/2014/07/15/tory-burch-fitbit-accessories/>

attachments.title: Tory Burch for Fitbit Collection: The Most Fashionable Wearable Accessories Yet
attachments.text: Designer Tory Burch officially launched her high-end accessory collection for the Fitbit Flex, bringing a stylish refresh to the fitness tracker market.
attachments.fallback: Mashable: Tory Burch for Fitbit Collection: The Most Fashionable Wearable Accessories Yet

text: Yeah I saw this too - though I hadn't seen that particular version of the device. I like it, and I think it solves one problem of these things always looking like athletic gear or poorly designed jewelry. I could see it helping them to reach some new people for sure. I'm not sure it solves any of the more fundamental issues - but still, it's interesting
